investigation.title: Adaptive response of Arabidopsis seedlings in microgravity and Mars reduced gravity environment is enhanced by red light photostimulation
investigation.description: The response of plants to the spaceflight environment and microgravity is still not well understood, although there has been an increased emphasis on this topic. Even less is known about plants' response to partial or reduced gravity levels.

project.title: Novel Explorations Into the Interactions Between Light and Gravity Sensing in Plants - Seedling Growth-2, Seedling Growth-3
project.funding: This work was supported by the Agencia Estatal de Investigacion of the Spanish Ministry of Science an Innovation, Grants #ESP2015-64323-R and #RTI2018099309-B-I00 (co-funded by EU-ERDF) and the Seedling Growth Project to the ISS LSRA2009-0932/ 1177, a shared project of ESA-ELIPS Program and NASA.

publications.title: From Spaceflight to Mars g-Levels: Adaptive Response of A. Thaliana Seedlings in a Reduced Gravity Environment Is Enhanced by Red-Light Photostimulation
publications.summary: From Spaceflight to Mars g-Levels: Adaptive Response of A. Thaliana Seedlings in a Reduced Gravity Environment Is Enhanced by Red-Light Photostimulation â€” 10.3390/ijms22020899

parameters.Growth Medium: sterile nitrocellulose membrane with 1% (w/v) Guar Gum affixed on blotter paper soaked in Murashige and Skoogs
